project.teaser: Precise information on the current status of forests is required to forecast forest management effects which allows informed policy decisions. To inform and support the implementation of these policy objectives, PathFinder will develop and demonstrate an innovative integrated...
project.objective: Precise information on the current status of forests is required to forecast forest management effects which allows informed policy decisions. To inform and support the implementation of these policy objectives, PathFinder will develop and demonstrate an innovative integrated forest monitoring and pathway assessment system. This system, for the first time, will allow a consistent EU greenhouse gas reporting of the LULUCF sector, but, at the same time combine such monitoring capability with advanced pathway assessment to help plan the essential policy and implementation steps towards achieving the policy targets. The continuous monitoring of forests facilitates controlling of target achievement and possibly adjustment of pathways. PathFinder goes beyond the state-of-art by the most efficient, combined use of field and remotely sensed data for high-resolution mapping and precisely estimating forest attributes. The cooperation of the largest forest monitoring organizations operating in the EU, i.e., national forest inventories (NFIs) and the network installed under ICP Forests, provides a rich data base of harmonized ground truth information which will be complemented by an innovative field survey of consistently assessed field monitoring sites. Advanced measurement devices will provide an audio-visual digital twin including genetic properties of the consistently monitored forest for maximum transparency and interoperability of new data. The analysis of combined databases will improve our understanding of fluxes among C pools. The precise forest information of the monitoring system will feed into a new scenario framework that forecasts future forest scenarios and outcomes of forest management alternatives. The scenarios facilitate trade-off analysis of forest ES and are potential alleys in the pathway assessment. The pathway assessment is a co-creation activity in which novel monitoring and scenario studies are integrated with EU-level stakeholder visions and knowledge
project.title: Towards an Integrated Consistent European LULUCF Monitoring and Policy Pathway Assessment Framework.

result.title: Updated DMP 2
result.description: The aim of the Data Management Plan is to ensure best practices for data management with regard to data security, storage, availability and accessibility according to the FAIR principles. In the DMP it will be specified, which data types are collected and generated, which standards will be used, and how the data can be exploited. For each main data type produced by the project, the plan will define how it will be made accessible for public use and further analyses in accordance with the FAIR principles.

result.title: Quality control plan
result.description: For the Quality Control Plan a reporting scheme and a progress-monitoring template will be prepared, according to which each Task and WP leader will inform about the progress. In the beginning of the project a quality control plan will be established, which will be implemented by using internal peer-review of each deliverable and milestone.

result.title: Policy target map
result.description: Map of EU, national and sub-national policy goals and targets. At EU, national, and sub-national level, goals and targets are set by different policy sectors (forest, climate, nature conservation and others) relevant for silvicultural systems. Targets are formulated to support the achievement of these goals often related to specific years (2030, 2050 or 2100).

result.title: Design alternatives of a consistent field survey
result.description: Documentation of design alternatives of a consistent field survey based on advanced field data collection approaches and methods for improved estimation of carbon fluxes. Based on information on existing European forest monitoring systems that collect field data, a consistent field survey and plot design will be developed that supports the existing systems.

result.title: Status on Land System Map
result.description: Status on Land System Models that are creating future forest scenarios based on the demands for forest management regimes.

result.title: Initial characteristics for mapping and estimation platform
result.description: Description of the initial technical characteristics of the mapping and estimation platform for:- Fetching and preprocessing of remotely sensed data - Fetching and preprocessing of auxiliary datasets- Input of field data and extraction of remote sensing variables- Model creation or re-parametrization- Model application to mapping and estimation of target variables with uncertainty quantification- Dissemination

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
